EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron plate production setup at position around (16.0, 71.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner mining drill at position (16.0, 71.0) facing down, extracting iron ore.
- Stone furnace at position (16.0, 73.0) smelting iron ore into iron plates.
- Wooden chest at position (17.5, 73.5) collecting iron plates from the furnace.
- Burner inserter at position (16.5, 74.5) transferring iron ore from the mining drill to the furnace.
- Burner inserter at position (18.5, 73.5) moving iron plates from the furnace to the wooden chest.
- Burner inserter at position (19.5, 73.5) intended to move iron plates from the wooden chest to a transport belt.
- Transport belt at position (21.5, 73.5) placed to move iron plates away from the chest.

This structure forms a connected iron plate production line from ore extraction to plate output onto a belt.

ERROR TIPS

### Fuel management for burner entities
- Burner inserters, drills, and furnaces require coal fuel to operate. Frequent "No coal in inventory to fuel burner inserter" and "EntityStatus.NO_FUEL" errors indicate insufficient or untimely fueling.
- Always ensure coal is harvested and inserted into burner entities promptly to avoid stoppages. Automate or schedule coal insertion to maintain continuous operation.
- Track coal inventory carefully before attempting to fuel entities to prevent insertion failures.

### Inventory and insertion errors due to empty inventory
- Multiple errors occurred when attempting to insert coal from inventory despite it being empty. Always verify inventory contents before insertion commands.
- Implement checks to confirm sufficient items exist in inventory before insertion attempts to avoid exceptions.

### Inserter waiting states and blocking
- Inserters frequently report waiting for source items or waiting for space in destination, indicating upstream or downstream blockages.
- Ensure upstream entities (e.g., mining drill) are fueled and producing items, and downstream entities or belts have capacity to receive items to prevent inserter blocking.
- Clearing chest inventories or moving items away from chests can help alleviate blocking.

### Placement order and spacing considerations
- Initial failures placing transport belts and inserters due to occupied tiles were resolved by adjusting placement spacing and order.
- Plan entity placement carefully to avoid overlaps and ensure all entities have free tiles for placement.

NAMESPACE
